intro: Monticalia carrikeri var. carrikeri, commonly known as the Carriker's monticalia, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and vulnerable species.
